property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: Afghan train tracks used to export goods to Uzbekistan

note.text: Afghanistan had a GDP of just over $20 billion in 2014. Despite a lack of farmable land, Afghanistanâ€™s economy is based largely on agriculture, with opium cultivation accounting for around 10% of the GDP. Although the country has mineral resources, it lacks the capability to make economic use of them. Illegal mining has funded both Taliban and anti-Taliban forces.
Until the 1990s, natural gas was a major export to Uzbekistan and Tajikistan, but the pipelines were closed with the fall of the Soviet Union.
